content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: It was an interesting challenge that is deeper then it first appears

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Well done, very clear description and easily achievable in 5 minutes
Only thing, if something was to be added, maybe include solutions with width lower than secondString's lenght ? With either the secondString cutted to adapt to the width, or a "IMPOSSIBLE" result ?

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple and clear enough to be a good Reverse Clash :)

No constraints? I'm surprised! Is it because the problem won't get that offered since it is a Reverse mode clash? I was expecting at least one constraint that the height will be 2 or more and width will be at least that of maximum characters on firstString and secondString (for the contents to fit into the box as per alignment). 

This problem seems well for fastest mode as well, along with Reverse that you've already suggested. Why not have it for both of these modes?

Another cool problem, I like the simplicity of your idea(s) and a good and clear solution that it desires.

Hi HG - Thanks for the feedback.

I don't think Constraints show on a Reverse.

I think I will just keep it as "Reverse Mode" only because I want players to figure out that they have to ignore the "to" and just use it to split up the first and last string.  If I have to explain that, then they don't have to figure it out :)

I appreciate the feedback, but I think I am testing a lot already, so I'm going to pass on this suggestion.

But this does inspire an idea for another clash, perhaps called something like "Too hot, too cold, just right" (like Goldilocks and the Three Bears), where the input is something and a height and a width.  If the input can fit exactly in a grid that size, then it's â€œjust right".  If too big or too small for the grid, then it's the other options  :)
